docs.snippet: Whatever their reservations about the presidential field, Supreme Court justices and the court benefit from remaining silent....
docs.lead_paragraph: Whatever their reservations about the presidential field, Supreme Court justices and the court benefit from remaining silent.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg for publicly discussing her personal view of presidential campaign, including her disparaging comments about Donald Trump; suggests her remarks merely contribute to already deeply divided partisan environment.

headline.main: Donald Trump Is Right About Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg
headline.print_headline: Mr. Trump Is Right About Justice Ginsburg

docs.snippet: I voted for Bernie Sanders. But it’s enough with the purity already....

docs.snippet: Whether Mrs. Clinton can also win over the 13 million Sanders voters will be one of her biggest challenges at the party’s convention and in the weeks ahead....
docs.lead_paragraph: Whether Mrs. Clinton can also win over the 13 million Sanders voters will be one of her biggest challenges at the party’s convention and in the weeks ahead.
docs.abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders endorses Hillary Clinton for Democratic presidential nomination, clearing last major obstacle to forming united party front ahead of election; Clinton still faces challenges in gaining support of liberals and independents who backed Sanders and will be closely watching for any deviation from progressive agenda.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Endorses Hillary Clinton, Hoping to Unify Democrats
headline.print_headline: With Sanders Endorsing Clinton, Democrats Put On United Front

byline.contributor: Amy Chozick reported from Portsmouth, Patrick Healy from New York, and Yamiche Alcindor from Cleveland.

docs.snippet: The nation's health care tab this year is expected to surpass $10,000 per person for the first time, the government said Wednesday. The new peak means the Obama administration will pass the problem of high health care costs on to its successor....

docs.abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column expresses hope that Hillary Clinton wins presidency in every state and that Democrats secure majorities in House and Senate during November elections; suggests sweeping victory would be best for America since it would force Republicans to rebuild into healthy center-right party.
